title.narrative: WASH SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: By 2021, local governments, especially in convergence counties and other vulnerable areas have strengthened capacity to assess WASH needs, plan, implement, manage and monitor Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Wash â€“ General, Water Supply, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, women and children have equitable access to sustainable, clean water and sanitation services, and practise improved hygiene and sanitation behaviours in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, local governments, especially in convergence counties and other vulnerable areas have strengthened capacity to assessWASH needs, plan, implement, manage and monitor WASH services

description.narrative: Construction work on;eight;water supply systems carried over from 2019 remain in progress. In addition, eight;water supply systems at;county and three;water systems at healthcare facility level;began to be constructed in 2021. The offshore procurement process for the water systems was started,;but supplies were not delivered to;the country by the end of the year. These supplies are essential for full completion of the project work. In the meantime, local construction materials have been delivered to eight;project locations.; | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:11/01/2022
